YBbPOXIAOgkkuS3dqYy2Ug.text: I'll be upfront here - I'm a total Group Therapy fan. From their hipster decor, to the yummy toasted almond latte, to the wonderfully sinful poached eggs, Group Therapy ticks all the boxes that a cafe should be. Nestled in the hip Duxton area, Group Therapy's entrance is rather hidden away, with only a signboard outside giving any indication of its location. But once you find the place, man, it's easy to while hours away there - people watching, or just hanging out with friends. And should you decide to go to this cafe - really, trust me. The poached eggs are to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore

3K2lAMpVNUiUwgLhHNObEQ.text: Was there for a Sunday afternoon coffee. Chai latte is not at all it should be,  ice mocha even worse, terrible in terms of coffee. two stars for the ambient only.

TOE13wftB5uUtetNd36XhQ.text: Love the ambience and food at this place. Their eggs benedict, while untraditional, is amazing! Best hollandaise sauce I've tasted. Compared to many other cafes, this place is definitely in my top three. The staff is very friendly as well.

CLI54MqJ2f0RE2oK7-B7Qg.text: I don't even want to talk about anything but their poached eggs on toast. Some of the best I've had anywhere, ever. On the menu this dish listed with salmon, but they swapped out the salmon with sauteed mushrooms for me with no problems. And they did not skimp on the mushrooms. Enormous doorstop of bread. Drowning in hot hollandaise. Yum. Not to mention that at $15 it's one of the lower priced versions of eggs benedict I've seen in Singapore. Another favorite is the minty mango passionfruit smoothie -- the mint is the 'twist' on the menu. I also love the rustic chic vibe of this shop house cafe, with lots of different types of seating areas. The very competent women who run Group Therapy are always pleasant. Great for a brunch spot, or a lunch spot if you want eggs benedict in the afternoon (I do) but I would totally fill up the place with friends for an evening do if I could.

E2oKc14H8H8Np1SfJr-Oww.text: We got here on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed. The noise level was significantly loud with no music, so if you would like peace and quiet, you could try this place on a weekday. I got the poached eggs with smoked salmon that everyone is raving about and it was good, but I wouldn't say that the eggs weren't beautifully poached. They were just....poached eggs. BUT, coupled with the smoked salmon on the thick slab of toast, and with the delish hollandaise sauce, the flavor combination really hit the spot. A great dish to have if you wanted something relatively light but still flavorful. The shepard's pie was tasty to me, but I do have a penchant for sweet and savory food. For those who does not appreciate sweetness in your salty foods, do not get it. The portions are pretty okay, but on the small side for a typical brunch. Worth a visit if you are around in the area craving some brunch, but not super delicious to go out of the way for.

YA0D48klYrgwi7nNdsD8Fw.text: Housed in a shop house along the iconic Duxton belt, group therapy whips up a mean all-day breakfast menu. I had their Poached Eggs & Smoked Salmon ($15) on Thick Toast and roasted almond latte. The hollandaise sauce coupled with salmon on top of a thick, well-toasted toast was delightful breakfast food. Their roasted almond latte ($6.80) tasted of distinctively of almonds (duh). It was special because of the flavour, but not spectacular. The café also comes with a selection of interesting beers and ciders. A creative vibe can be felt, as many artistic-looking types congregate to discuss work or just peace out. The venue is open for booking, I rememebr attending an event Group Therapy hosted for TED (TED.com), which I really enjoyed. The staff are friendly, patient and approachable, plus there are quite a number of powerplugs nearby - which makes it a prime place to get stuff done.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore

_aoE7W-aFMKcDZG852_ClQ.text: Runny poached egg - check.homemade hollandaise sauce - check.thick brioche toast - check.Great coffee - check.happy camper - check.I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Truffle ravioli
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. coffee + carrot cake
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. egg benedict

CM6Un2O3IrY0GxY6NGnbJA.text: The first impression of the place was good- relaxing,  casual ambience, lots of delicious-sounding food on the menu. It quickly went downhill from there. My partner and I were seated at a table for four, nursing our drinks and conversing, when a waitress came up to us saying "Excuse me, you're sharing this table with someone else." Those were her exact words. Now, I don't mind having to share my table with strangers if I had been warned of the possibility ahead of time and asked if I was ok with it. The way she put it was just insensitive. The other couple sat down next to us and the 4 of us sat in awkward silence. The table was small and we were literally rubbing elbows with strangers. As soon as another table freed up, they requested to change tables. Barely 10 mins later, another waitress came up again and said "Excuse me, another couple will be sitting at this table." For the second time, our conversation died down. It was getting very disruptive. This time, the two companions were not shy about talking out loud. The first thing we heard was:A: "How have you been?"B: "I've been sick lately."A: "Really? Me too."Needless to say,  we spent the rest of our meal in silence, focused on eating fast and getting out of there. Food was decadent - I had the Croque Madame. The bacon was great and cheese was abundant. But in Singapore, where people eat not just for sustenance but as a way to relax and socialize, this place barely even made it on my list of go-to places for brunch. The sad thing is, Group Therapy's intended vision was to be a place where people connect over food.

3jDNIFTysFtqk0nErTm8tg.text: we stopped here after a utterly brill dinner at etna (just downstairs from this place), just to grab a bit more dessert and coffee - really, just to give in to the greed.it had high standards to live up to, as the cap to a great meal - but fell a tad short. our pecan tart - always a delight to order and anticipate in light of the gluttony that ought arrive - was definitely packed tight with nuts, but those lovely things were bound with a strange sort of caramel. not sticky, or fragrant with the flavours of burnt sugar, this seemed rather like a slightly gummy type of uhm, gum. not quite worth the calories, and I gave up just a bite in.the drinks were pedestrian, but it was enough that night for us to sit down and chat. we'd had a good time with the italian meal downstairs - and this felt rather like a rather calming bit of something to tide us over till bedtime. objectively speaking, it wasn't sparkling, and the queues are outrageous for something so.. normal. but it's a bit of hideaway (though a crowded one), prices aren't mad and the stuff isn't terrible - so it might just work if you were in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. pecan pie
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. a hipster shot

E4jrePw1Vl6IBoNp_vWMNA.text: I'm a bit torn about this place. I basically fell in love with it via yelp reviews and photos before ever going. But upon visit I felt pretty let down.The poached eggs and salmon on toast is the picture of my ideal breakfast. Thick toast, eggs, smoked salmon, hollandaise. In my mind it was delicious but in reality it was not. Realize I'm really breaking away from the trend of the reviews here so perhaps it was just an issue with mine...- the bread was hardly toasted and definitely not warm (consistency leads me to believe it was thrown in the microwave for a few seconds and then topped with the eggs and sauce, as the bread was tough and relatively hard to cut)- the eggs were hardly warm - the hollandaise sauce had a weirdly similar consistency to mayonnaise, and also was not warmI'm used to a breakfast dish such as this being served relatively hot, so "hardly warm" is rather unpleasant. No one likes warm (soon-to-be-cold) eggs.Usually in an eggs bene I am using the bread / muffin to soak up every last bit of the hollandaise, but in this instance I found myself scraping most of it off. I've never seen a hollandaise this consistency before, and I've had my share of it elsewhere. It seems like they mixed something into it so the sauce could be made in bigger batches and stand to sit around without constant stirring. If you've made hollandaise sauce before you know how temperamental it can be, and requires a lot of love and attention. Not mayo (or whatever additive was in there - it was not a pure egg/butter/lemon juice recipe). I really really wanted to love this place. My food aside, the redeeming qualities I saw were..- my friend's burger looked delicious- the ambiance is very cute- the beer list has some interesting options- the rest of the menu dishes look promisingI'm hopeful was just a fluke, and intend to give Group Therapy another chance, possibly for dinner. Unfortunately I'm just not in a rush to go back. There are a lot of other great looking places in Duxton I'd rather try first.

pKnJ1NOW9qjjeDNFUCVfGQ.text: one of my favourite cafe in singapore with their fabulous food and cuppa.my fave would be the udon salad, egg w hollandaise sauce and they always have this couscous salad for their side dish which is very unique and yummy.the down thing is it can be quite crowded and noisy during peak times and your hair can get smelly if you eat in there.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. One of fave lunch plc in tanjong pagar.

J7kiDIOLHhPS41Bm41DDrw.text: Everything about this café is what brunch should be. Somewhat hidden in a second floor, after climbing a somewhat sketchy staircase, one enters a space reminiscent of something out of Boston's beacon street. With it's high ceilings and very home-y feel, one finds a table to indulge in the classics: be it a nice sandwich or indulging in a delicious Belgian waffle, ice cream [not] optional.  Coffee, ironically, is pretty ordinary, but the food and ambiance more than make up for it. It's the kind of place that transports you from Singapore, and makes you want to spend the entire afternoon nursing that hangover from last night while not-so-guiltily indulging. Don't be selfish though, pack up and get moving soon, as many other enthusiastic brunchers are waiting for your spot!

LW1pJ8g8evuYGqoTIr8Yvw.text: Great place to get brunch and work for a few hours. Good coffee and good looking clientele.

Fou5qDiK85cWUS_VGl4Wug.text: Came here for brunch with my husband and one of his friends since it's right around the corner from where we live. I had such a hard time deciding on what to eat.. I ended up ordering a plate of mini croissants with two sunny side up eggs. My husband ordered the peanut butter waffles with honey and no bananas. My order ended up coming with scrambled eggs so I was a little annoyed.. They took it back, fixed the egg situation but by then my croissants weren't as warm. I remember there was another issue as well but it's not coming to me. Anyways, the waffle was amazing, my eggs were good, the croissant was a bit cold. All in all a three star experience!

CoWMoHENHUX4JLDs_XvpGw.text: Group Therapy Coffee has a nice, laid back vibe that puts you at ease almost immediately. Mis-matched furnitures, decorative pieces and crockery dots the spacious cafe. A twinge of vintage, a touch of rustic and a dose of randomness works to the cafe's aesthetic advantage. It's a place that makes you feel like anything goes - a pretty rare occurrence in this day and age.Having been craving for a some egg benedict for quite some time now, I eagerly ordered a serving of poached eggs that came with smoked salmon, toast, gruyere cheese and hollandaise sauce ($15). Dessert is always a must, hence the lemon meringue tart ($6.50) and a cup of roasted almond latte ($6.50). I felt that the food was quite pricey for the potion given, its taste was decent but nothing spectacular. The eggs were nicely poached but the thick slice of toast sitting underneath it was a little too hard and dry. Fortunately, the runny yolk saved it from being too bad. I couldn't taste the gruyere cheese and actually forgot that it was part of the dish until I began writing this a few minutes ago. I'm now thinking they might have forgotten to put the cheese in but oh well.The lemon meringue tart was not bad, bursting with flavour with a tangy custard, coupled with a sweet meringue top. The only complaint was that the meringue was a little soggy, but I liked that the custard was filled with real lemon zest, that gave it a nice bite. The next time I need an escape from demands/datelines/work, I have a place to run to for some respite and perhaps some much needed therapy. Food or desserts aren't exactly their forte but a place like that, with its quirkiness, ought not to be overlooked. It's a pretty great place, whether for a meet-up with the girlfriends, or for chilling alone with a book. Just try not to go there hungry I guess?

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. a little bit like home :)

UNW0knLInvlu_f0ysX9K3A.text: Hidden on the second floor along Duxton road, Group Therapy is a must-visit for brunch and coffee lovers looking for a relaxing space.The ambience is fantastic. It's neither too hot nor cold, and there is lots of bright natural light pouring in from the large windows. It feels cozy, and I can imagine spending a whole day here with coffee and a book.And for some reason, it's never crowded whenever I visited, which makes me believe that this place is still underrated compared to the other popular brunch hang-outs.The Eggs Benedict I ordered were served with marvellous hollandaise sauce. It's served on hot toasted bread, which helps to catch the runny yolk so they don't escape from your mouth!Also must-try: the waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore

GEg6RhIhRMRZ7YYtUBdUeg.text: The good:  Ok, I didn't hate hate the place, but I'm struggling to find something positive to say.  Not that it's the worst of the worst, but it's the worst of a growing trend of cafes that  think just because they can put eggs on a plate and designs in a latte that they are special and can charge a premium.  I do remember getting a tasty water.  Does that count?  The bad:  Let's start with the food.  Below par at best.  I can cook better at home, confirmed.  Second is the atmosphere, I think training bra music was pumping the whole time, and the furniture is made up of Salvation Army leftovers.  Couches, high tops, tables, nothing goes together.  I think I saw a bike on the wall though...props for that.  My coffee was...forgettable.  Fully staffed, but I still had to air traffic control someone over when I wanted something.    The ugly:  Not easy to find, full of students chatting it up or jamming out on their laptops.  I'm really most upset about the food.  I ordered a eggs benedict and asked for ham.  They put bacon bits on my eggs.  Bacon bits people!

ooka-pqo3nNwYA-AJhLcvw.text: I like this place, the looks of it, the wooden tables and the cosy atmosphere. I have been here for breakfast, and I love the muesli yoghurt, although I would prefer to have a non-sugar version but that you cannot find in Singapore, can you...It is rather expensive, though, and opens very late. One morning I got there 20 min before they opened, and I was put off because I was not let in with my morning newspaper. You don't blame them, do you, but what harm could would it have done if I had sat quietly at a table reading my newspaper while they were opening up? It would have shown some entrepeneur spirit, and had made me feel valued. So I roamed the streets and got back as the first guest.I do recommend this place.

YvX_IaRHHO_bd_yPMYgrbA.text: A better than average place for brunch. I really enjoyed the shepherd's pie, although it wasn't exactly what I was expecting. But I'm always impressed when a place surprises me some decent beers on the menu. For a coffee shop, their craft beer and cider list was exceptional. It's not a bar, but if you're on Duxton Hill and craving a good beer, this is a good place to stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. There's a respectable selection of craft beer here.

8DxMGLOhBxF-du3VA6UfPw.text: Great place to chill out with your friends and grab a cuppa coffee while you're at it. It's nestled in a cosy unit along Duxton Road, and the owners are really friendly and the service is pretty warm and welcoming.Food wise, I came here for an event and we had the quiches, mango salad and some fish wrap sandwiches which were pretty yummy. They have a private space which can be cordoned off so this is a good place for events as well.

nRyLTCISmeZk7rquoUumWQ.text: I really love this place and have been coming for years. They are personal, they remember you, and on a Sunday they are the only ones in town who still have seating! I think the 2nd floor gives them a cool "hidden" factor but I also really appreciate that they have a mix of table and cushy-sofa seating, and offer "deluxe" brunch items like avocado and smoked salmon. I will definitely keep coming back!

pOyeusFEuHGPxl1pHAe7Kw.text: We were on the prowl not just for a great place for brunch, but one that served amazing poached eggs. After some research, we decided to head to Group Therapy and, boy, we were not at all disappointed with this choice. The poached eggs were absolutely delicious - served atop a thick slice of toast and smothered with a hearty, creamy hollandaise sauce. My only regret is that my partner and I ordered one each, which proved to be way too much for us because the portion was so generous. I suggest sharing one and getting something lighter for your second selection. It's casual, yet is evidently on the hipster's radar, so expect crowds, especially on the weekends.

BnlQWPr1cptgeFQ1zu0jmw.text: I come here very often because along with the Pigeonhole, GT is a chilled out little place in Duxton Hill that is great for working out of. With fast wifi, good airconditioning and good seats, as well as good coffee, it is nice to be able to 'come home' and sit down and jump into work and jump just as quickly into socializing as well.I frequently schedule work meetings here as it's central and a good place to be at, overall.It's located on the upstairs unit of a typical Duxton shophouse. The decor is a nice mix of industrial and warm coziness, and the owners and baristas and waitstaff super friendly and inviting.The wine and beer list is also above average for a cafe of this type. They certainly know what they are drinking!The space is also available for events in the evenings.

QHS2f_ZxtVhTdX3BJtFimg.text: A nice little cafe. It isn't along the line of star hacks and the like where you order, wait for your coffee and no one bothers with you.I went with the thoughts it is like that.

gRczKbyqtueTzg-aj7ge9w.text: Rightfully named and living up to it, Group Therapy Café offers group-counseling sessions, but in this case the shrinks are your friends (and maybe a slice of yummy carrot cake or a freshly brewed cuppa served by their cordial, jolly baristas!). It might a tad bit ominous at first with a 'GROUP THERAPY upstairs' greeting you as you enter a dark, narrow staircase, keep going towards the light at the end of the tunnel and you'll be impressed. Group Therapy was brightly sun-lit and complete with the tinkering of teacups and the aroma of freshly brewed coffee accompanied with the muffled chatter of bosom buddies.The ambience is perfect - having been here on 4 separate occasions - loving it each and every time, each corner promises a different experience. There were many different sets of furniture, fit for the odd group of 5 or if it's just a corner for one, there'll be one waiting for you!

Tn6-HMy6i22o6TnQyWWlGA.text: I will start by saying this place is a little hidden. you need to take a set of stairs to get to the seating area, and since I wasn't expecting this, it did take me a bit to find it (maybe an extra 5 mins)  but, it was worth it. inside decor is cute, and there is a sofa area to sit or longer family size tables. mainly for 4 groups of 4-5. not a huge seating area so I can see this place getting busy. they have a diverse menu, serve breakfast all day, but have soups, waffles, pasta....i opted for their French toast. it was so good. I would go back ag as in just for that.  their Oj was fresh too. my friend had the beef stew and it came with a nice slice of toasted garlic bread. a nice place to catch with friends over good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. French toast!  amazing!

1xydAlqMLwQ_pkPCW16UAw.text: Chili crab pie ($17) - 2.5 starsThe chili crab filling was a bit too sweet, dry, and maybe wasn't exactly flavourless, but it didn't have that umami kick to satisfy. The pastry was dry as well. Wouldn't order it again.Waffle with matcha and earl grey ice cream ($14) - 4 starsThe waffle and ice creams were excellent! I'd come back for this.The cleanliness of the place was a little suspect - the cutlery had odd stains on them. Overall my friend was rather put off on the whole. I've been here 2 or 3 times now and would probably try other cafes in the area before returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore

VIu6ZpPx_HeQxOZ72k2I3g.text: The name of this joint just makes me laugh, perfect. I've passed by here 12987 times since it's across the street from Lululemon and right by Cru and Yoga Lab.  You have to look for the sign and walk up stairs.  Very sneaky.  Anyway, had some friends in town and we went for brunch.  Cute little place, but make sure you order at the counter, we waited at our table for about 10 minutes before realizing this. Had the eggs benedict, the pancake stack and the creme brulee waffle.  All delish, but the pancakes were the REALLY good.  Coconut lattee rounded things out.  Nice service, but it does get crowded later.  Def. will be back!

dUzWwyzff1lBg7KP8c8tcg.text: Group Therapy offers a casual environment for people to enjoy brunch and/or coffee in a loose setting where you don't feel rushed out the door. I came by here on a Saturday afternoon and was surprised by the number of tables and seats available. There is a mixture of tables (standard and high) as well as couches that are available at various "rooms", giving visitors a number of choices based on your preference. I tried the Almond Latte which I found to be tasty, at $6.50. There was no queue and the coffee was delivered to my table a few minutes after I sat down after ordering at the counter. I brought a book to read at the cafe but found the ambiance a bit too noisy/social for me to have a peaceful read. Overall decent offerings in the Tanjong Pagar  area. Will have to come back to try the brunch food next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore

C2az8tWcLUvy391qJ-ll7w.text: I've been here before but aaaages ago with a friend and we had pancakes, which I remember were a good big portion and tasty. BUT this time I had some savoury food and it didn't disappoint either!! I just wish the brunch menu was an all day affair.  My only qualm with the Eggs Benedict is that there was WAYYY too much Hollandaise sauce! Too much of a good thing is also bad guys... PS their iced teas are gr8 too! I just wish they werent so pricey so I could've ordered 2!

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs Ben + Guac + Mango Ice Tea

hLayAsPNXttiXn5yiX_iAw.text: Came here with high expectations because of the yelp reviews and pictures. But left with disappointment.Ordered a cup of herbal tea since it was late and didn't want to take any more caffeine. But the tea bag was just soak into a cup of warm water, first time drink tea in a warm way. Felt like paying S$5(or S$6)to get a cup of warm tap water. I was excited about the sunny side up toast since I love thick toast. But the toast was hardly toasted, warm outside and cold inside. Won't come back anymore. Just give one more star for the chilled environment and free wifi (ask for the password)

cBTsR7qFUD6lnscFeDv03Q.text: Fantastic coffee and decent breakfast noms, but it's pricey and the service can be a bit plodding. I love the atmosphere of the place and its story, but I'm not sure it's worth nearly SGD 50 for two people to have brunch.A+ for flat whites, though!

nfRjxWSFn8H0nEdZl1S9Gg.text: If you don't know it exists, it's easy to walk by Group Therapy. But make sure you don't, because this hidden gem really is just that -- a gem. The owners of this place are incredibly warm and friendly and that is reflected in the service. Everyone who works there is great. I love that you can come to this place with a laptop and sit for hours. And it helps that the coffee and food is delicious. At one point, my husband was completely addicted to their almond lattes. Personally, it's too sweet for  me, but I do love their regular coffee drinks. Their food is also very good. They use good ingredients and serve them with a smile. All in all, the experience here is fantastic. They're also an event venue!

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore

rhodX45OeMqx0Nv6swAufw.text: People have different taste of coffee, so I wouldn't make a comment about it or the review reflects it. (But, just to let you all know, the coffee tastes too acid, which I don't usually like)Overall, the coffee was not hot but warm.My wife got a tea and the water wasn't hot but warm, so the tea had no taste whatsoever.I wouldn't come back here for sure.

N4o5EFMJeP2JGsLF3hm4ww.text: Waffles are awesome. But chocolate sauce is very amateur effort. Diluted Hershey style. Corn fritters are not to be missed. Pancakes are really good too. Love their salted caramel sauce.

FXfC0o2KftIVITdOv_grkA.text: I only had scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, a cappuccino, a passion fruit tart, and an espresso. All were excellent and reasonably priced. The hours of this place are really weird, especially that most days they start serving breakfast at 11. It reminded me a lot of Jimmy Monkey, and the cappuccino in particular had almost identical flavor to theirs.It's a little like they are trying too hard to be hipster, but I didn't really see anything to complain about, except the scrambled eggs were a little runnier than they are in America. I guess if you don't like your scrambled eggs runny, you should ask for them to be cooked more than usual. The food and coffee was great, especially the cappuccino and passion fruit tart.

vkE6SyQgpZsQaMWIjYkOYg.text: Good coffee. Nice relaxed ambience and food was decently portioned. Lots of such cafes but this holds its own and I will come back again

l5RgAw3CrSU0HFLeUk5MKg.text: Group Therapy is located above Etna and it boasts a spacious interior- High ceilings, comfy sofas (albeit a little too close to the diner next to us). GT does an all-day-breakfast even though the selection is quite small. I saw granola with yogurt and another dish together with Poached eggs with smoked salmon and hollandaise sauce. They also have other light bites like panini sandwiches, chicken ham pie, salads etc. There is also some simple main courses like a meat stew. W wasn't hungry so I only got to taste the Poached Egg. Fluffy toasted white bread. Crispy and nice on the outside. Very similar to that of Wild Honey. Nicely poached and runny egg yolks. Salty smoked salmon which were slowly cooked by the warmth of the eggs that rested nicely on them. And that hollandaise sauce is so cheesy and creamy! I like that it's not too sour but the heaviness of the cream became a little too much halfway into the meal.You gotta do the Brother's Toffee Apple Cider. Absolutely my favorite. :) Cider with brekkie? Anytime. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs with smoked salmon

tFlWjCEBIy72pgvi3WWmzA.text: Not everything at Group Therapy is good but most of their dishes are yummy. Like their chili crab pie. And their brunch items like poached eggs and their croque Madame. Their waffles are not too bad too! A tip: they don't take reservations. Only walk-ins.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Check this out! So yummy, right?!

MfaK7SRVKQkr_nuCCwktLg.text: 45 minutes to get food. Eggs not done properly. Mediocre pancakes. Getting chased down for more money due to billing error - in most parts of the world you let that go if its your own damn fault, not chase customers for nickels and dimes. Such a lame place. Staff pleasant enough just the customer service and competence coming up short  and good needs to be better than mediocre.

Ia0oOZ8PYNavUoMmpwdjDw.text: Good vibe, friendly service. I had the pumpkin waffle with poached eggs, and guacamole on the side, really tasty. Only comment is that waffle was too sweet, It would been fantastic if it had been savoury, I could only earlt half of it or else I'd destroy the experience. Chocolate with coconut milk and 7-spice chai latte were delicious. I can see myself coming back, I hope they consider fixing the pancake mix.

2HmSIIcOn8RtZTZmRT6Lwg.text: Located at the second storey of a quaint shophouse, this is certainly an excellent place for a weekday lunch getaway.Good variety of mains as well as all day breakfast with good coffee. Definitely recommended. Try the Shepards pie as well as the poached eggs

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Poached eggs

I_kEsaRBsLnD17u9WD0ebQ.text: It's embarrassing when I rave about a place to my kakis and when I finally force everyone at gunpoint to grab a meal here, the food sucks.That's what happened a couple of weeks ago. My kakis at that time were a bunch of my colleagues including my boss.Up until then, I'd always been a fan of the WIld Mushroom Truffle Ravioli. The menu changes every week, last I checked, it wasn't on the menu.The raviolis must be hand-made (thumbs up). But this time, they were barely stuffed with anything. One of them had nothing inside (thumbs down).So, I won't be coming back here. I don't like guessing what kind of quality I'll get.

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Wild Mushroom Truffle Ravioli

PPUnLL5xp1-NCEga6Bwe8A.text: Very comfy place for brunch and early afternoon coffee. Friendly stuff and decent coffee

photos.caption: Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Latte, butter and cyrup waffles

rABN14WzGe0H95dYv8GXkg.text: It is best if you visit on a friday or saturday where they open till late! It gets busy during mid noon time. If you're near outram park mrt or chinatown mrt, you can make your way to this cafe to chill or just to hang out with friends. This cafe's specialty is their all day breakfasts! I tried their poached egg with salmon and it is just heavenly~!Their salmon is fresh and off a good proportion. (Now just a thin slice of salmon) The poached egg is good as well. Not over cooked and under cooked. The sauce they used is hollandaise sauce and it compliments the whole dish very well. :)I will definitely go there again!
